question.text: A basic rule when on motorways is

explanation.text: You should normally travel in the left-hand lane unless you are overtaking a slower-moving vehicle. When you are past that vehicle move back into the left-hand lane as soon as it’s safe to do so. Don’t cut across in front of the vehicle that you’re overtaking.

answer.text: use the lane that has least traffic
keep to the left-hand lane unless overtaking
overtake on the side that is clearest
try to keep above 50 mph to prevent congestion
